intro: Hieracium hypochoeroides subsp. guaranum, commonly known as the Guaraní hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, exhibiting a rosette of basal leaves and flowering stems. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, achene-like seeds. It is adapted to thrive in temperate to subtropical climates and is often found in open habitats.
